Text: I will exalt You, my God the King; I will bless Your name forever and ever.
Context: David commits to praising God as a personal act of worship.

Text: Every day I will bless You, and I will praise Your name forever and ever.
Context: David intends to make praise a daily practice, indicating continual, devoted worship.

Text: Great is the LORD, and greatly to be praised; His greatness is unsearchable.
Context: David acknowledges God's greatness as beyond human understanding.

Text: One generation will commend Your works to another; they will tell of Your mighty acts.
Context: David speaks of the importance of passing down the knowledge of God's works from one generation to the next.

Text: I will meditate on the glorious splendor of Your majesty and on Your wondrous works.
Context: David expresses his personal commitment to reflect on the glory and wonders of God.

Text: Men will speak of the power of Your awesome works, and I will proclaim Your greatness.
Context: David anticipates that people will talk about God's acts, and he adds his personal declaration to that testimony.

Text: They will pour forth the fame of Your abundant goodness and will sing of Your righteousness.
Context: There is an expectation of overflowing praise from others, echoing the goodness and righteousness of God.

Text: The LORD is gracious and compassionate, slow to anger and rich in loving devotion.
Context: David reflects on God's character, emphasizing His grace, compassion, patience, and steadfast love.

Text: The LORD is good to all; His compassion rests on all He has made.
Context: David proclaims God’s universal goodness and care for His creation.

Text: All You have made will give You thanks, O LORD, and Your saints will bless You.
Context: David envisions all of creation as well as the faithful giving thanks to God.

Text: They will tell of the glory of Your kingdom and speak of Your might,
Context: The focus is on God's kingdom and might, suggesting a declaration of His sovereign rule and power.

Text: so that all men may know of Your mighty acts and the glorious splendor of Your kingdom.
Context: The purpose of this proclamation is evangelistic, intending that all people hear of God's acts and majestic reign.

Text: Your kingdom is an everlasting kingdom, and Your dominion endures through all generations.
Context: The LORD is faithful in all His words and gracious in all His actions.
column7: Here, David affirms the eternal nature of God's kingdom and His faithfulness across all time.

Text: The LORD upholds all who fall and lifts up all who are bowed down.
Context: David speaks to God's character as a sustainer and encourager of those in need.

Text: The eyes of all look to You, and You give them their food in due time.
Context: David points to God as the provider for all creatures, acknowledging His timing in meeting needs.

Text: You open Your hand and satisfy the desire of every living thing.
Context: This verse conveys the idea of God as a generous provider who meets the needs of all.

Text: The LORD is righteous in all His ways and kind in all His works.
Context: David declares the goodness and kindness of God's nature, seen in all His works.

Text: The LORD is near to all who call on Him, to all who call on Him in truth.
Context: There is a promise of God's presence for those who sincerely reach out to Him.

Text: He fulfills the desires of those who fear Him; He hears their cry and saves them.
Context: David expresses confidence in God listening and responding to those who revere Him.

Text: The LORD preserves all who love Him, but all the wicked He will destroy.
Context: Contrast is made between God’s protective love for the righteous and the eventual judgment of the wicked.

Text: My mouth will declare the praise of the LORD; let every creature bless His holy name forever and ever.
Context: David commits personally to perpetual praise and invites all of creation to join in exalting God.
